content.description: Which of the following series converge?
content.question: <math alttext="the sum from k equals 1 to infinity, of, the fraction with numerator 1, and denominator k squared, plus 1, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><munderover><mrow><mo>∑</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>k</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>∞</mi></mrow></munderover></mrow></mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>k</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math><math alttext="the sum from k equals 1 to infinity, of, the fraction with numerator k, and denominator k squared, plus 1, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><munderover><mrow><mo>∑</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>k</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>∞</mi></mrow></munderover></mrow></mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>k</mi></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>k</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math><math alttext="the sum from k equals 1 to infinity, of, the fraction with numerator k squared, and denominator k squared, plus 1, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><munderover><mrow><mo>∑</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>k</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>∞</mi></mrow></munderover></mrow></mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>k</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>k</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: Skill 3.D: Apply an appropriate mathematical definition, theorem, or test.
